course.name: Film Script Analysis and Scriptwriting
course.description: This course is designed to provide students with a fundamental understanding of the art of scriptwriting. Through the analysis of different scripts and screenplays, students will gain a solid foundation in the format, language, and style of film scripts while writing their own scripts. The course takes a "from script to screen" perspective, examining the relationship between scripts and finished films, assisting the studentsâ€™ creative decision-making progress. By the end of the course, students should be familiar with script analysis and scriptwriting-related methods, techniques, and crafts, and be able to produce refined script analysis reports and scriptwriting works as course outcomes. For students enrolled in the Extended Major Program in DMCA and students with consent from the instructor only.
